meanings.definition: Thin or slender in form or consistency
meanings.sent1: The spider's web was so tenuous that even a gentle breeze could break it.
meanings.sent2: Her tenuous fingers delicately held the fragile glass ornament.
meanings.sent3: The tenuous thread of hope kept him going through tough times.
meanings.sent4: The tenuous connection between the two ideas was hard to grasp.
meanings.sent5: The tenuous bridge swayed precariously in the wind, making everyone nervous.

meanings.sent1: The tenuous rope snapped under the weight of the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: His tenuous excuse for being late did not convince anyone.
meanings.sent3: The tenuous argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: Their tenuous friendship couldn't withstand the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The tenuous support structure collapsed with a loud crash.

meanings.sent1: The tenuous memory of the event faded with each passing day.
meanings.sent2: Her tenuous understanding of the complex topic left her confused.
meanings.sent3: The tenuous explanation only added to the confusion.
meanings.sent4: The tenuous image on the old photograph was hard to make out.
meanings.sent5: The tenuous outline of the figure in the fog created an eerie atmosphere.
